intro: Chorizanthe chrysacantha var. compacta, commonly known as the compact chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its native habitat.
